sub_title: Guest Researcher at University of Amsterdam
summary:
I obtained a Ph.D. degree in Physics at University of Porto, Portugal. My Ph.D. thesis was on the subjects of Dark Energy and Varying Fundamental Constants. I succeed in carrying out accurate network simulations of the evolution of the universe and performing statistical analysis of spatial pattern networks.

Having a restless mind, I decided to expand my scientific knowledge and use my expertise to investigate Mathematical and Computational Biology. By combining analytical and computational skills, I have applied the Rock-Paper-Scissors game and Lotka-Volterra equations to describe the trophic interactions between the species. As a guest researcher at the Institute for Biodiversity and Ecosystem Dynamics at University of Amsterdam, I started collaborating with Prof. Maurice Sabelis (in memoriam), Dr. Maarten Boerlijst and Dr. Arne Janssen. We have worked in predation and disease mediated coexistence and systems with mites and plants and in collaboration with Dr. Kateřina Staňková from Department of Knowledge Engineering at Maastricht University.

Since 2009, I have a permanent position at Federal University of Rio Grande do Norte, in Brazil. I work as an assistant professor teaching Mathematics and Physics for engineering students and supervising undergraduate students. I love teaching and I feel fulfilled in transmitting the knowledge and inspiring them to build their own careers. Furthermore, this job has given me the opportunity to work in an academic environment, where I obtained valuable experience in acquiring research funding, managing projects and leading teams. Due to these administrative responsibilities, I have matured and developed skills to solve conflicts and promote collective interests.

I am a dynamic, sharp-witted, resourceful and creative researcher who is able to break out of usual thought patterns to see things afresh and push forward new ideas, innovative mould-breaking concepts and winning formulas.

projects.title: Trithrophic systems: plants, prey and predatory mites
projects.description:
We apply physics and mathematical expertise to the field of evolutionary and ecological 
dynamics. In particular, we combine evolutionary game theory and population dynamics in a well-mixed vs spatially extended setting to investigate coexistence of interacting species in simple and complex food webs and on alarm signalling strategies of plants in predator-herbivore-plant systems.

contributors.headline: Guest Researcher at University of Amsterdam
Associate Professor in Dynamic/Evolutionary Game Theory | Delft Technology Fellow | 💙💛

projects.title: Numerical and Analytical Investigation of Field Theory
projects.description: This project is focused on cosmology systems and soft condensed matter, non-perturbative field theories at finite temperature and perturbative aspects of quantum theory supersymmetric fields. The first line deals with the study of topological defects, which has recently assumed an important role in explaining physical phenomena both in Cosmology and in Condensed Matter. In this sense the investigation of the evolution of topological defect networks in nematic liquid crystals. We also work with non-perturbative techniques in quantum chromodynamics.

company.name: Federal University of Rio Grande do Norte

profile_positions.company: Federal University of Rio Grande do Norte
profile_positions.description:
I give lectures of Mathematics and Physics for engineering students School of Science and Technology, supervise undergraduate students, carry out scientific researches, lead groups and projects, acquire research funding from external sources and manage departments.

* Lecture Experience: Calculus, Differential Equations, General Physics and Theory of Relativity.

*Oral Presentation: International Conference: AMMCS-2013, Waterloo, Canada, Title: Dynamics of pattern networks in rock-paper-scissors type model.

* Administrative Experience: Chief of Department of Mathematics and Director of the 
Council of Professors.

* Scientific Journal Referee: Europhysics Letters, Online ISSN: 1286-4854, European Physical Society, Mulhouse, France.

* Academic Advisory: Tibério Azevedo Pereira (2012-2016), Lara Cavalcante Freitas da Silva (2012-2014), Kamila Araújo Nobre (2010-2012), Joel da Cruz Campos (2009-2012), Francys Anthony da Silva (2009-2011), Wallacy Medeiros (2009-2010).

* Participation in Judging Comission’s Boards:

2012 Public Contest: Assistant Professor, Federal University of Paraíba, Area: Mathematical and Computational Modelling.
2011 Public Contest: Assistant Professor, Federal University of Rio Grande do Norte, Area: Mathematics and Physics.
2010 Public Contest: Assistant Professor, Federal University of Rio Grande do Norte, Area: Mathematical and Computational Modelling.
2010 Public Contest: Assistant Professor, Federal University of Rio Grande do Norte, Area: Mathematics and Physics.
2009 Public Contest: Assistant Professor, Federal University of Rio Grande do Norte, Area: Mathematics and Physics.
profile_positions.title: Associate Professor

profile_positions.description:
Expanding my scientific knowledge by using my expertise to investigate Mathematical and Computational Biology. Combining analytical and computational skills, I have applied the Rock-Paper-Scissors game and Lotka-Volterra equations to describe the trophic interactions between the species. At the Institute for Biodiversity and Ecosystem Dynamics at University of Amsterdam, I have worked with Cry Wolf games applied to systems with mites and disease mediated coexistence, in collaboration with Prof. Maurice Sabelis (in memoriam), Dr. Maarten Boerllijst and Dr. Arne Janssen. In this meantime, I also started working with Dr. Kateřina Staňková from Department of Knowledge Engineering at Maastricht University, where I had the pleasure of giving a seminar by invitation of Dr. Frank Thuijsman.

* Oral Presentation in Conferences:

2014 - Spatio-Temporal Dynamics in Ecology, Leiden, The Netherlands, Title: Spatio-Temporal Dynamics of Disease and Predation can promote coexistence in Lotka-Volterra Competition Systems.

2014 - International Conference on Applied Mathematics, Hong Kong, China, Title: Topological properties of interface networks in Rock-Paper-Scissors models.

2014 - IX European Conference on Mathematical and Theoretical Biology, Gothemburg, Sweden, Title: Dynamics of spatial pattern networks in predator-prey systems.

2014 - 16th International Symposium on Dynamic Games and Applications, Amsterdam, The Netherlands, Title: Interfaces between partnerships in rock-paper-scissors games.

* Scientific Journal Referee:  Annals of the International Society of Dynamic Games, Society of Dynamic Games, Amsterdam, The Netherlands.
profile_positions.title: Guest Researcher

profile_positions.description:
Scientific research in numerical description of spatial patterns in Soft Matter. Using accurate numerical codes, we have solved tensorial equations and describe the arising and evolution of string networks in nematic liquid crystals. 

* Lecture Experience: Physics for Biology and Physics for Pharmacy.

* Poster Presentation: II Workshop on Modern Trends in Field Theory, João Pessoa, Brazil, Title: Dynamics of domain wall networks.
